cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 255 mi SSE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to drift north-northwest through Sunday, turn west-northwest on Monday crossing the Yucatan Channel, then accelerate northward over the central Gulf and approach the northern Gulf Coast (likely Louisiana/Mississippi) late Tuesday night or Wednesday.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch only for Pinar del Rio, western Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Cuba, northeastern Yucatan Peninsula, and the U.S. central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana to the Alabama/Florida state line
weather_observation.wind: At this time only a low (â‰¤6%) chance of reaching 34-kt winds; most likely outcome is breezy northeast winds below tropical-storm strength.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Significant storm surge is not expected along the upper Texas coast given the forecast track well to the east.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands may brush the upper Texas coast but widespread totals expected to remain under 2 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells and higher seas over the western Gulf could create hazardous navigation and berthing conditions early- to mid-week.
